column4: Please give me a troubleshooting suggestion. I've managed to create a CD image with brasero, now I'm trying to burn it -- but the Burn button is inactive. What can I do?
make sure the cd doesn't have something written to it already
brasero reports it as blank
how big is the image?
I've got two, neither works (623280000 bytes and 660646224 bytes)
CD-R claims 700MB
sorry, not really familiar with brasero, so I'm stabbing in the dark
I'm running Ubuntu in a VM -- but should it make a difference, since it reports the blank CD as writable?
no idea. I wouldn't think so
okay, thanks... I'll try with k3b. Annoying thing is, k3b won't read the brasero image, so I'm going to have to re-create that.
it didn't just make an iso?
no, a bin/toc (audio CD)
'man update-grub' tells you how to make permanent changes
thanks!
thanks. Perfect!
oh, for the non-ubuntu ones
you just have to put them outside the DEBIAN-AUTOMAGIC-something section
I mean, place the entries after the line ### END DEBIAN AUTOMAGIC KERNELS LIST
